contextId.information: These words form a merism that includes all plants. AT: "cedar tree ... hyssop bush" or "the greatest of trees ... least important of bushes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
men from the city of Gebal (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Cypress is a kind of wood that was used for building the temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Ivory is the hard, white substance from the tusks or teeth of large animals. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:10:18|10:18]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

These animals live wild in Africa. At the ends of their four limbs are what look like human hands and feet, and they have long tails. Some people consider baboons a type of ape. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
